item.name: Nike / Off-White Blazer Lows
item.desc:
True to Virgil Abloh's wide-ranging and open-source take on product development and modification, the Nike x Off-White в„ў Blazer Low brings together a multi-disciplinary, multi-sport aesthetic. While exploring Nike's archives, Abloh became inspired by iconic basketball, skateboarding and trail running silhouettes and started to reconsider their shapes and features in a new light.

By bringing together multiple sports and silhouettes, this Blazer Low's distinct make-up underscores Abloh's design language. Through collaborative design sessions and via text message threadsвЂ”one of Virgil's favourite places to workвЂ”with Nike's design team, he became focused on "mixing languages for a new signature", emphasising how that happens when unrelated elements are brought together unexpectedly. Abloh and his team executed his thought process through the standout TPU heel piece that sits atop the Blazer Low, which draws inspiration from the Air Terra Humara's classic heel shape. To even get to this radical point, at one stage during the design sessions, Abloh directly asked: "Can we вЂ¦ splice the real Humara tooling and fuse it into a vulcanised sole?" This kind of playful verve for new opportunities is what allowed for new possibilities and with it, the Off-White в„ў Blazer Low.

Signature Nike x Off-White в„ў detailing completes the shoe, including an accented over lace, Swoosh tab, exposed foam tongue and punched-out holes, offering a utilitarian, DIY attitude to a sneaker designed with expert craft, knowledge and a passion for pushing boundaries. - NIKE.COM.

item.name: Adidas / KSI Forum HI
item.desc: If anyone underestimates you? You prove them wrong. Take it from UK rapper, creator, boxer and influencer KSI. He rose to the top through drive, determination and the confidence to follow his own path. Now he's put his signature spin on the adidas Forum shoes with a paisley print that turns reflective under light, three lace jewels and his tagline "underestimated" on the ankle strap. - ADIDAS.CO.UK.

item.name: Nike Air Jordan 1 "HERITAGE"
item.desc: These colors run deep within Jordan Brand's DNA. University Red, Black, and White are instantly identifiable with the Jumpman, but they've never been combined like this before. Featuring a White midsole and White leather base with University Red and Black tumbled leather, this OG style is rich with Jordan Brand heritage. Designed for a timeless silhouette like the Air Jordan 1, this simple array of classic colors pop in championship harmony. - NIKE.COM.

item.name: Converse / A-COLD-WALL* Aeon Active CX
item.desc: The future of comfort is active. Blending the conceptual lens of A-COLD-WALL* and game-changing Converse CX technology, the limited-edition Aeon Active CX is built for forward progress. The unique stretch bootie construction and exaggerated heel kick creates smooth ease of entry. Revolutionary CX foam underfoot teams up with a Crater foam midsole вЂ“ made with about 12% recycled scraps from the factory floor вЂ“ to provide all-day comfort. Suede and leather overlays with rounded lines integrate classic Converse DNA into the future-forward design. Through a bold color combination, subversive graphic language and translucent outsole, Samuel Ross applies his distinct aesthetic to this new, convention-breaking silhouette. - CONVERSE.CO.UK.

item.name: Nike Air Jordan 1 Lows "PINK"
item.desc: Inspired by the original that debuted in 1985, the Air Jordan 1 Low offers a clean, classic look that's familiar yet always fresh. With an iconic design that pairs perfectly with any 'fit, these kicks ensure you'll always be on point. - NIKE.COM.

item.name: Nike Air Jordan 1 Lows WMNS "DARK MARINA"
item.desc: Always in, always fresh. The Air Jordan 1 Low sets you up with a piece of Jordan history and heritage that's comfortable all day. Choose your colours, then step out in the iconic profile that's built with a high-end mix of materials and encapsulated Air in the heel. - NIKE.COM.

item.name: Nike Air Trainer 1 "LIGHT SMOKE"
item.desc: From the gym to the courts and everywhere in between, the famed cross-trainer from '87 lets you travel with ease and without a glitch. Details like the forefoot strap nod to the original, while reflective-design graphics and iridescent accents come together for a futuristic and utilitarian aesthetic. Designed at the time for performance sport, the heel's Air cushioning and mid-height collar keep your ride comfortable and secure for today's adventures. - NIKE.COM.

item.name: Nike Dunk Lows "FOSSIL ROSE"
item.desc:
Originally created for the hardwood, the Dunk later took to the streetsвЂ”and as they say, the rest is history. More than 35 years after its debut, the silhouette still delivers bold, defiant style and remains a coveted look for crews across both sport and culture.

Now, the university hoops OG returns covered in Aura and Phantom nubuck overlays with calm and cool colour blocking. Modern footwear technology brings the design's comfort into the 21st century, while a Fossil Rose Swoosh steals the show. - NIKE.COM.

item.name: Nike Dunk Lows "Jackie Robinson"
item.desc: Jackie Robinson was the first African American to play in the MLB. He broke the baseball color line when he started at first base for the Brooklyn Dodgers in 1947. To celebrate the 75th anniversary Nike are releasing a special & unique Dunk Low. Featuring the Dodgers colours while quotes are etched into the upper panels. Stay locked for a release date very soon.

item.name: Nike / Doernbecher Freestyle 2022
item.desc:
Nike has officially released details in regards to their 2022 Doernbecher Freestyle collection to raise money that will benefit development of new treatments and ensure the bets care for children. 

Expect these to release to retailers during Spring 2022 after the Ebay auction starting today. 

Below is a little more detail on the designers of each pair (in order of images) - 

Nike Dunk Low
Designed by Zoe Taafe who is 17 years old from Tualatin, Oregon. She was diagnosed with Granulomatosis with polyangiitis. 

Nike Blazer Mid вЂ™77
Designed by Ayman Wamala who is 13 years old from Salem, Oregon. He was diagnosed with sickle cell anemia. 

Nike Air Jordan 5 Lows
Designed by Michael Wilson who is 11 years old from Dayton, Oregon. He was diagnosed with krabbe disease. 

Nike LeBron 19
Designed by Sam David Phelps who is 14 years old from Portland, Oregon. He was diagnosed with spina bifida. 

Nike Court Zoom Vapour Cage 4
Designed by Maylee Phelps who is 15 years old from Portland, Oregon. She was diagnosed with spina bifida. 

Nike SB Zoom Stefan Janoski
Designed by Catalina Vazquez who is 16 years old from Kelso, Washington. She was diagnosed with von hippel-lindau. 

Nike Air Force 1 Fontanka
Designed by Cidni OвЂ™Brien who is 16 years old from Lebanon, Oregon. She was diagnosed with anomalous aortic origin of left coronary artery.
